transportAdvice: Lille has an efficient metro, tram, and bus network that connects the city centre with most tourist areas, making it easy to get around without a car. The historic centre is compact and very walkable, and taxis are readily available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold and grey with frequent rain and occasional frost; pack warm, waterproof layers.
Still cold and damp with overcast skies, though daylight hours begin to lengthen slightly.
Temperatures begin to rise but rain remains common; early spring feels cool and changeable.
Mild and increasingly pleasant with occasional sunny spells, though showers are still frequent.
Warm and green with a good mix of sunshine and showers; a comfortable time to explore outdoors.
Warm early summer weather with longer days and occasional thunderstorms in the afternoon.
The warmest month of the year with mostly sunny days and relatively low rainfall.
Warm and generally sunny, similar to July; a popular time for outdoor dining and festivals.
Mild and pleasant with cooling temperatures and increasing cloud cover as autumn approaches.
Noticeably cooler and wetter with frequent overcast days; autumn foliage adds colour to the city.
Cold, damp, and often foggy; the famous Braderie de Lille is long past and the city quietens down.
Cold and grey with a festive Christmas market atmosphere; rain and occasional frost are common.
